title: activation does not work for perl-xml-parser
body:
`spack activate perl-xml-parser` links e.g. `XML::Parser` here:

```
./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/lib/perl5/x86_64-linux/XML/Parser.pm
```

which is not one of the directories that is searched (aka `@INC`):

```
hartzelg@blah:spack-perlplay (bug/perl-xml-parser)$ (module purge; ./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/bin/perl -e 'print join("\n", @INC)') | sed -e 's/^.*opt/.\/opt/'
./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/lib/site_perl/5.24.1/x86_64-linux
./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/lib/site_perl/5.24.1
./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/lib/5.24.1/x86_64-linux
./opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.24.1-35ejv4426dmzreum4ekdibu3ddmhquvi/lib/5.24.1
```

The links should probably go into `sitelib` or `sitelib`/*arch*.  You can ask `Config` for the path using something like this:

```
perl -MConfig -e 'print $Config{sitelib}'
```

I'm fuzzy on the exact keys to use (X, installX, or Xexp; for sitelib and sitelibarch).  This snippet explores their values, but "someone" should check the docs....

```perl
use Config;

my @keys = qw(installsitelib sitelib sitelibexp installsitearch sitearch sitearchexp);
foreach my $k (@keys) {
    print $k, " -- ", $Config{$k}, "\n";
}
```
